link.synopsis: When a shady movie producer films her during a night of drunken depravity, a usually straight-laced college girl must get her hands on that tape before the abstinence-only organization that sponsors her scholarship catches wind of it. But when the producer flees, the coed and her pals must hit the road to track him down and save her college career. This comedy from director Clare Kilner stars Rob Schneider, Jenna Dewan and Brianne Davis.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: After moving to London with his pub-singer mother, Jill (Lesley Manville), Sam (Shaun Evans) rises quickly at a public relations firm by sleeping with the older owner of the company, Sheila (Stockard Channing). But he puts his career in jeopardy when he falls for Sheila's daughter, Kate (Amanda Ryan). Meanwhile, timid landlord Vince (Bob Hoskins) tries to find the courage to tell Jill he has feelings for her in this romantic comedy from Britain.
link.title: synopsis
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: This musical comedy cult classic follows Vince Lombardi High School's fervent love of rock 'n' roll -- particularly The Ramones -- and the students' quest to party. After a few principals have gone nuts and quit, the latest one tries to end the fun.
link.title: synopsis
South Beach Academy / Rock 'n' Roll High School Forever
End of the Century: The Story of the Ramones
Another State of Mind: Social Distortion, Youth Brigade and Minor Threat
The Sex Pistols: The Great Rock 'n' Roll Swindle
Ladies and Gentlemen, The Fabulous Stains
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: Love may yet win the day in this gentle comedy, which follows still-grieving widower Ned Stevens as he resists his daughter's attempts to nudge him back into dating and frets over the seemingly perfect boyfriend she brings home from college.
link.title: synopsis
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance
Dr. Dolittle: Tail to the Chief
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: This romantic comedy charts the course of young love when a chance encounter between high schoolers Dave and Aubrey sends them over the moon for each other. Over the course of a weekend, the two discover the intensity of genuine emotional intimacy.
link.title: synopsis
Celebrating the Art of the Short Film

link.synopsis: Centering on the homicide investigation of a Roman prostitute in a riverside park, director Bernardo Bertolucci's debut film follows police as they interrogate those in the park at the time of the murder, hoping the killer is among them. Each suspect's version of the night of the murder is related via flashbacks intercut with scenes from the hooker's last day of life. Giancarlo De Rosa, Vincenzo Ciccora, Alvaro D'Ercole and Romano Labate star.
link.title: synopsis
The Girl Who Knew Too Much
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
The Gospel According to St. Matthew
5 Dolls for an August Moon / Four Times That Night

link.synopsis: Andy Lau, Nick Cheung and Alex Man star in this adventurous romp, part of writer-director Wong Jing's hugely successful God of Gamblers series. Once again, the Chinese government turns to King (Lau) and his compatriots for help in finding Peter Chu, a man who managed to bilk the reigning administration of tens of billions of dollars, spiriting the money away to the glitz and glamour of Las Vegas. So, it's off to America for King and co. …
link.title: synopsis
Book and Sword: The Final Battle
Once Upon a Time in China 3
Once Upon a Time in China 2

link.synopsis: A dynamic duo on- and off-screen during the 1980s, former teen icons Corey Feldman and Corey Haim reunite two decades later for this A&E reality series that finds them frequently at odds after Haim moves in with Feldman and his wife, Susie. Once inseparable friends, Feldman and Haim are a contemporary version of "The Odd Couple" -- Feldman is a sensible, vegetarian neatnik, while Haim is a mercurial, carnivorous slob.
link.title: synopsis
The Ride: 7 Days to End AIDS
A Shot at Love with Tila Tequila
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
MTV: The Real World You Never Saw: Paris
Britney and Kevin: Chaotic: The DVD
The Real Housewives of Orange County

link.synopsis: In this philosophical feature from Jean-Luc Godard, the film's co-writer and co-director, Anne-Marie Miville, stars as one of a pair of communist journalists who set out to make an honest documentary about their employer's printing plant.
link.title: synopsis
Jeanne Dielman, 23 Quai du Commerce, 1080 Bruxelles
La Chambre / Hotel Monterey / News from Home
Don Juan (Or If Don Juan Were a Woman)
I Will Walk Like a Crazy Horse

link.synopsis: Aimless, unemployed and on the verge of being broke, Ronnie (Robert Buchanan), Wal (Billy Greenlees) and a couple of their teenage friends concoct a crazy scheme to rob a plumber of stainless steel sinks, but trying to unload the stolen merchandise repeatedly leads to disaster. Bill Forsyth writes and directs this breezy caper comedy that finds the inept crooks growing increasingly frustrated with each annoying setback they face.
link.title: synopsis
Harry and Walter Go to New York
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Monty Python and the Holy Grail

link.synopsis: When their favorite hangout, Jon's Pool Hall, is in jeopardy of being taken over by money-grubbing pool mogul Lord Billiards (Gordon Goodman), a group of 20-something self-proclaimed geniuses band together to save the day. Written and directed by Brian Petersen, this irreverent indie comedy stars James Avery ("The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air"), Eric Artell, Maura Claire Barclay, Dean Bates, Barbara Beneville, Wendy Calio and Joe Costello.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself

link.synopsis: Three affable young adult roommates -- Jack (John Ritter), Janet (Joyce DeWitt) and (for the first five seasons) Chrissy (Suzanne Somers) -- share the challenges and joys of single life in this breezy sitcom that was a hit from the moment it made its 1977 debut. The coed living arrangement compels ladies' man Jack to pretend that he's gay to hoodwink their prudish landlord (Norman Fell) -- later replaced by the foppish Ralph Furley (Don Knotts).
link.title: synopsis
John Ritter Comedy Special: Being of Sound Mind & Body
One Day at a Time: Season 1
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
The New Adventures of Old Christine
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2
Can She Bake a Cherry Pie?

link.synopsis: Childhood friendships get another lease on life in this heartwarming tale about Stan (Rick Stear), who convinces Daniel (played by Jon Cryer, who co-wrote the script) to help him track down their old pal, Richie (Rafael Baez), rumored to be homeless on the streets of Brooklyn's Coney Island. Their journey takes them down memory lane, as they discover hard truths about themselves, friendship and life.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: Went to Coney Island on a Mission from God: Be Back By Five
title.short: Went to Coney Island on a Mission

link.synopsis: In this high-impact action-comedy, Chan plays a pair of long-lost twins: John was raised in the United States and is a famous classical musician, while Boomer is a rowdy mechanic who likes to race cars.
link.title: synopsis
Operation Condor 2: Armour of the Gods
Once Upon a Time in China 2
Once Upon a Time in China 3
Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame
Once Upon a Time in China
Old Skool Killaz: Secret of the Dragon
Zu: Warriors From The Magic Mountain

link.synopsis: Basil Dearden directs this caper comedy that follows veteran con man Silas (Richard Attenborough), his lover Liz (Alexandra Stewart) and their young protg Bob (David Hemmings) as they trot the globe, swindling African militants and other high-profile marks out of their cash. But tension among the three crooks grows when Bob decides he would make a better criminal leader than the aging Silas -- as well as a more virile boyfriend for Liz.
link.title: synopsis
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: Follow the heroics of French paratroopers (including Anthony Quinn and Alain Delon) as they jump into the conflict-torn former provinces of Indochina and Algeria. The troops don't always agree -- with each other or their government -- which only adds more tension to an already battle-weary group. Maurice Ronet and Michele Morgan also star in this war drama based on a novel by Jean Lartéguy.
link.title: synopsis
The Battle of the River Plate
The Charge of the Light Brigade

link.synopsis: Blowing into the Windy City by train with a noble but nave plan to "seek his destiny," small-town youth Ben Harvey (Beau Bridges) finds himself apprenticing under a curmudgeonly reporter (Brian Keith) at one of Chicago's largest newspapers and befriending a madame (Melina Mercouri). Norman Jewison directs this period comedy based on Ben Hecht's autobiographical novel that earned Oscar nods for sound, art direction and costume design.
link.title: synopsis
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
Lent in the Month of March
Live a Little, Love a Little
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: Silent-film master Buster Keaton directs and acts in this double feature. Both films in this classic combo showcase Keaton's amazing physical comedy, innovative visual effects and captivating personality. In Our Hospitality, Keaton resurrects a long-standing Southern feud when he falls for a gal on the wrong side of the fence. In Sherlock Jr., Keaton plays a daydreaming movie projectionist in love with an unattainable woman.
link.title: synopsis
Foolish Wives / The Man You Loved to Hate
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 2
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 3
Arbuckle & Keaton: The Original Comique Paramount Shorts 1917-1920: Vol. 2
Ben-Hur: Collector's Edition: The Silent Version
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Charley Chase Collection 2
The Passion of Joan of Arc

link.synopsis: &NFb;&NFb_;When ex-spouses Bette Midler and Dennis Farina reunite at their daughter's wedding (14 years after their nasty divorce), they threaten to ruin the event -- by falling in love again! Veteran comedy actor, writer and director Carl Reiner ("The Dick Van Dyke Show"), working from a script by the screenwriter of Mrs. Doubtfire and 2003's Freaky Friday, keeps the laughs coming but never at the expense of genuine, mature romance.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Struggling actor Victor Bukowski (Douglas Henshall) is heartbroken over the pending marriage of his ex-girlfriend Sylvia (Lena Headey). Leaving the pub drunk, Victor awakes to find himself back in time to the day they broke up, and he embraces his second chance. But fate has other plans when Victor meets Louise (Penélope Cruz). María Ripoll makes her directorial debut with this romantic comedy co-starring Mark Strong and Elizabeth McGovern.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
How the Garcia Girls Spent Their Summer
InuYasha: The Movie 4: Fire on the Mystic Island
The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
InuYasha: The Movie 3: Swords of an Honorable Ruler
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
S. Darko: A Donnie Darko Tale

link.synopsis: Mistaken as consultants to a beauty pageant in the town of Happy, Texas, two escaped convicts go along with the ruse, masquerading as gay lovers Harry (Jeremy Northam) and Wayne (Steve Zahn). In trying to teach Happy's Junior Misses to win, the two run up against a sheriff (William H. Macy) with the hots for Harry, and a local teacher (Illeana Douglas) catches Wayne's eye. Director Mark Illsley's comedy was a winner at the Sundance Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Steve (Perry King) is a wealthy, insensitive playboy who leaves a trail of discarded hearts in his wake. But when his exes join forces to get revenge, Steve lands in purgatory -- and to save himself, he must be reincarnated as a woman (Ellen Barkin). Director Blake Edwards (who also helmed Victor/Victoria and Breakfast at Tiffany's) delivers this intriguing, gender-bending comedy, which features a spectacular performance by Barkin.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: How to Get Ahead in Advertising
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: A veritable who's who of 1960s Hollywood is represented in this rollicking, satiric Western about a boisterous temperance leader (Lee Remick) out to stop a cavalry-protected whiskey shipment from reaching parched Denver miners. Burt Lancaster commands the cavalry but meets his match in Remick. Elmer Bernstein wrote the rousing score for this 1965 comedy narrated by character actor John Dehner.
link.title: synopsis
Clark Gable Collection: The Tall Men
The Good Guys and the Bad Guys
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines

link.synopsis: In this high-flying musical comedy, a love triangle unfolds around a sensuous Brazilian beauty (Dolores del Rio), an ace bandleader (Gene Raymond) and his friend (Raul Roulien). But romantic intrigue aside, it's Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers who steal the show in their first on-screen pairing. Produced by Merian C. Cooper, the film features aerial stunts and some elaborate in-flight choreography, as well as the Oscar-nominated song "Carioca."
link.title: synopsis
The Story of Vernon & Irene Castle
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife

link.synopsis: After discovering aspiring actress Judy (Doris Day) at the Warner Bros. commissary, actors Dennis Morgan and Jack Carson, who both star as themselves, agree to hire her as the leading lady in their new picture but soon begin battling over her affections. In addition to the Oscar-nominated song "It's a Great Feeling," this musical comedy also includes appearances by Gary Cooper, Joan Crawford and Edward G. Robinson.
link.title: synopsis
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
I'll See You in My Dreams

link.synopsis: Shirley MacLaine is Lucy Dell, an actress who disguises herself as a geisha in order to land a lead role in her director husband's (Yves Montand) film version of "Madame Butterfly." Assisting in her ruse is the film's producer, played by a well-cast Edward G. Robinson. Shot in Japan, this lavishly produced romantic comedy with a few unexpected twists was directed by legendary cinematographer Jack Cardiff and was nominated for an Academy Award.
link.title: synopsis
The History & Art of the Geisha
Hell on Heels: The Battle of Mary Kay
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Orson Welles: The Stranger/Orson Welles on Film

link.synopsis: In this engaging comedy of manners, the radiant Loretta Young plays Katrin "Katie" Holstrom, a naïve Minnesota farm girl who leaves home to study nursing in the big city. Bilked out of her cash the first day, Katie lands a job as maid to U.S. Sen. Glenn Morley (Joseph Cotten) and soon finds herself thrust into politics when she takes a public stand for immigrants. Young's performance netted her the Academy Award for Best Actress.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
James Cagney Collection: The Time of Your Life
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
Best of the Loretta Young Show: Season 1
You Can't Take It with You
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas

link.synopsis: Robert Redford stars as jewel thief and ex-con John Dortmunder, who's hired to pinch a priceless African sparkler from a New York City museum in this Oscar-nominated caper comedy. To help pull off the elaborate heist, Dortmunder drafts a safecracker (George Segal), a wheelman (Rob Leibman) and an explosives expert (Paul Sand), but the job snowballs after a string of missteps and mishaps. Zero Mostel shines in a supporting role as a slimy lawyer.
link.title: synopsis
Harry and Walter Go to New York
The Great Bank Hoax / The Great Bank Robbery
Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: The marriage of mutual friends reunites former college roommates Bob (Alexis Arquette) and Brendan (Christian Maelen), who tried to ignore the sexual tension that always flowed between them. Brendan finally comes out to Bob at the reception, but is it a case of too little, too late? Writer-director Brian Sloan's romantic comedy co-stars Lauren Vélez and Jamie Harrold and features a rare cameo from Marni Nixon.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Legendary funnymen Walter Matthau and Robin Williams star in this black comedy as Sonny Paluso and Donald Quinelle, two unemployed strangers who witness a robbery and become the targets of a hit man (Jerry Reed). Donald arms himself to the teeth and enrolls in a survival training course, retreating to the woods. Meanwhile, the crook confronts Sonny, promising to call off the dogs if he can keep Donald quiet. Michael Ritchie (Fletch) directs.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: In this feature-length debut from acclaimed television sketch comedy troupe Kids in the Hall, obsessed scientist Chris Cooper (Kevin McDonald) invents a happiness drug called Gleemonex, and soon the entire country hits cloud nine. But the drug proves to have a nasty side effect, and Cooper must put a stop to the happy habit before it's too late. The Kids play more than 40 wild and weird characters.
link.title: synopsis
The Kids in the Hall: The Pilot Episode
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny

title.regular: Kids in the Hall: Brain Candy
title.short: Kids in the Hall: Brain Candy

link.synopsis: The animated, irreverent, foul-mouthed kids from Comedy Central's "South Park" are up to no good again -- and will swear to you about it -- in this collection of episodes from creators Matt Stone's and Trey Parker's long-running, Emmy-nominated hit television series. Includes here are three episodes, all of which involve the supernatural: "Korn's Groovy Pirate Ghost Mystery," "Spooky Fish" and "Gnomes."
link.title: synopsis
South Park: The Cult of Cartman
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
The Man Show Presents: Girls on Trampolines
The Man Show Boy / Household Hints from Adult Film Stars
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Worst Week of My Life
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story

title.regular: South Park: Ghouls, Ghosts and Underpants Gnomes

link.synopsis: Dave Foley stars in this comedy as Nelson, a nebbish business executive who blows a fuse when he's passed over for a promotion. After being overheard shouting death threats at his boss, Nelson panics when he finds the guy dead in his office. Fearing he'll be the prime suspect, Nelson goes on the lam; the police realize he's not the killer, but Nelson's too busy running from them to realize they're not looking for him!
link.title: synopsis
Return to the Bat Cave: The Misadventures of Adam and Burt
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear

link.synopsis: New Yorkers Rachel (Jennifer Aniston), Ross (David Schwimmer), Chandler (Matthew Perry), Monica (Courteney Cox), Joey (Matt LeBlanc) and Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) kept the comedy rolling for 10 remarkable seasons. This collection includes the following Season 1 episodes: "The One with the East German Laundry Detergent," "The One Where Underdog Gets Away," "The One with the Stoned Guy," "The One with the Birth" and "The One Where Rachel Finds Out."
link.title: synopsis
Sunday Morning Shootout: The Best of Season 1
Spin City: Michael J. Fox: His All-Time Favorites: Vol. 2
Michael Phelps: Greatest Olympic Champion: The Inside Story
The Ellen Show: The Complete Series
The New Adventures of Old Christine

link.synopsis: This first installment of the popular PBS comedy features eight episodes of handyman "advice" from creator and star Steve Smith. Get out the duct tape and enjoy as fix-it guy Red Green (Smith) and his friends conduct the most hilarious experiments. Episodes include "The Wind-Powered Boat," "The Salt and Pepper Shakers," "Maple Syrup," "Fire Brigade," "The Beef Project," "The Badger Project," "The Network Deal" and "The Science Fair."
link.title: synopsis
Red Green, DVD: Duct Tape Virtuoso Deluxe
Red Green's: We Can't Help It -- We're Men
The Red Green Story: We're All in this Together
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
A Bit of Fry and Laurie

link.synopsis: In an inspired bit of typecasting, Clint Eastwood and Burt Reynolds star as a steely police detective and a slick private eye, respectively, in this 1984 Richard Benjamin-directed film that melds comedy and high-octane thrills. The two men are so different it's almost inevitable that they end up working on the same case together ... and, against all odds, maybe even solving it!
link.title: synopsis
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way

link.synopsis: Nick (Rick Otto), a psychotic college student studying serial killers, is throwing a party that he plans on turning into the ultimate mass murder. When the guests begin to disappear one by one, it seems as though Nick's getting his wish. But who's killing them? It's black comedy all the way in writer-director Mark Anthony Galluzzo's satirical horror film, which features an appearance by actor Jason Mewes (Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back).
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: Peter Medak: The Washingtonians
Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation
The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning
A Nightmare on Elm Street 6: Freddy's Dead: The Final Nightmare
Do You Wanna Know a Secret?
Halloween 5: The Revenge of Michael Myers
Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers
Friday the 13th: Part 4: The Final Chapter
A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors
A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master
A Nightmare on Elm Street 5: The Dream Child

link.synopsis: One of the BBC's best and most famous series, "Yes, Minister" brought subtle but biting British humor to the small screen week after week. Newbie cabinet minister Jim Hacker (Paul Eddington) bumps up against the machinations of veteran civil servant Sir Humphrey Appleby (Nigel Hawthorne) in this comedy of manners. This series includes the pivotal pilot episode, "Open Government."
link.title: synopsis
The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin: The Complete Series
Open All Hours: The Complete Series
To the Manor Born: Silver Wedding Anniversary
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Yes, Prime Minister: The Complete Collection
National Geographic: King Tut's Final Secrets
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
A Bit of Fry and Laurie

link.synopsis: Steven Soderbergh directs, writes and stars in this freewheeling comedy stuffed to the gills with visual and verbal puns. Soderbergh plays dual roles in a bizarre cast of characters with absurd names like Elmo Oxygen and T. Azimuth Schwitters. Nerdy copywriter Fletcher Munson (Soderbergh) finds himself under pressure to write a speech for a revered spiritual guru, while dentist Jeffrey Korchek (Soderbergh) starts an affair with Munson's wife.
link.title: synopsis
Avant-Garde: Experimental Cinema of the 1920s and '30s: Vol. 1
How to Get Ahead in Advertising
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
One Week from a Man's Life

link.synopsis: Shortly after a psychic tells Darlene Bates (Jada Pinkett Smith) that Mr. Right is about to enter her life, the sexy party girl finds herself set up with a reserved law clerk (Tommy Davidson). Seemingly mismatched, they get off to a rocky start -- and a night of misadventures ensues. Dave Chappelle, Paula Jai Parker and Aida Turturro also star in this farcical romantic comedy featuring cameo appearances by LL Cool J and Billy Dee Williams.
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man

link.synopsis: The legendary zany comedy trio of Larry, Moe and Curly is back in action -- and this time, they're making some dangerous brushes with the law in this collection of five slapstick shorts. In "Idiots Deluxe," Larry and Curly accuse Moe of attacking them, while in "The Three Trouble Doers," the Stooges hit the Wild West for some frontier justice. "Pop Goes the Easel," "Yes, We Have No Bonanza" and "In the Sweet Pie and Pie" round out the program.
link.title: synopsis
The Three Stooges: Nutty but Nice
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 2
The Three Stooges: Goofs on the Loose
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 1
The Three Stooges Go Around the World in a Daze
The Three Stooges: Cops and Robbers
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: International House
Snow White and the Three Stooges
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
The Three Stooges: Soup to Nuts
Laurel & Hardy: Air Raid Wardens / Nothing But Trouble

title.regular: Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law
title.short: Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law

link.synopsis: Richard Pryor's 1977 comedy special on NBC was so successful that the network offered him a 10-week contract for his own show, but scheduling issues and other production difficulties reduced the schedule to only four shows. Those hours, however, are widely regarded to be among the best of Pryor's career. His mixture of political satire and sharp wit kept guests John Belushi, Maya Angelou, Robin Williams, Sandra Bernhard and more on their toes.
link.title: synopsis
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
The Best of the Flip Wilson Show
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life is Calling
The Dick Cavett Show: Rock Icons
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
The Pat Paulsen Half a Comedy Hour
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In
Saturday Night Live: 25 Years of Music
The Best of the David Steinberg Show
Bob Hope: Bob Hope on TV
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour VII / At the Movies with Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour V & VI
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour III & IV
Sid Caesar Collection: The Buried Treasures
The Sid Caesar Collection: The Fan Favorites
Soupy Sales: In Living Black & White
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!

link.synopsis: In Go West, Groucho Marx takes Horace Greeley's advice and high-tails it to the frontier, where he hooks up with Harpo and Chico for their usual hilarious antics. In The Big Store, Groucho is a detective investigating shady Douglas Dumbrille's department store. Brothers Harpo and Chico get in the way, as usual, in this goofy comedy that features crooner Tony Martin trilling "Tenement Symphony."
link.title: synopsis
Marx Brothers: Marx Brothers Mixed Nuts
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
Groucho Marx: You Bet Your Life: The Lost Episodes
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: It's a Gift
Sorrowful Jones / The Paleface: Double Feature
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
The Return of the Pink Panther
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: You Can't Cheat an Honest Man
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law
The Three Stooges: Nutty but Nice

link.synopsis: Frankie Avalon and Annette Funicello relive the glory days of their beach blanket bonanzas in this 1987 comedy. Playing a husband and wife who are visiting their daughter in Southern California, the two prove to still have a little bit of "fun in the sun" left in them, joining their daughter on the shores for a party to remember. Features cameos from David Bowe, Pee-Wee Herman and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas

link.synopsis: Set amidst turn-of-the-century France, director Jean Renoir's delirious romantic comedy stars Ingrid Bergman as a beautiful but impoverished Polish princess who drives men -- from the upper classes to the hoi polloi -- to fits of desperate love.
link.title: synopsis
Naughty Girl / Come Dance with Me
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: In this sequel to the family comedy Baby Geniuses, the pint-sized adventure continues with a new generation of talking toddlers. This time, the baby geniuses must foil a nefarious mind-controlling scheme led by media mogul Bill Biscane (Jon Voight). Legendary baby Kahuna -- part ultra-cool spy, part superhero -- joins babies Archie, Finkleman, Alex and Rosita in a race to stop the villainous Biscane.
link.title: synopsis
3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain

link.synopsis: This sequel to the 1994 PBS miniseries is marked by an addictive, outrageous comedy that's given the series an almost cultlike following. Set in 1970s San Francisco, the show continues to revolve around the lovelorn residents of 28 Barbary Lane -- including the bewildered but aspiring Mary Ann Singleton, the libidinous Brian Hawkins, the marijuana-growing Mrs. Madrigal and many other fascinating characters.
link.title: synopsis
More Tales of the City: Disc 1
More Tales of the City: Disc 2
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes

link.synopsis: Ellie Parker (Naomi Watts) lives the typical life of a struggling actress in Hollywood, juggling auditions, second jobs, bills, friends and family to cobble together a satisfying existence. But somehow, she finds a way to laugh through it all in this charming comedy that first found its audience as a short film. Writer-director Scott Coffey co-stars alongside Rebecca Rigg, Mark Pellegrino and Chevy Chase.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Actress Eileen Sherwood (Janet Leigh) and her sister Ruth (Betty Garrett) plan to take Manhattan by storm once they arrive. But Ruth's dreams are immediately quashed when her new boss, editor Robert Baker (Jack Lemmon), orders her to write about her gorgeous sibling's love affairs. Naturally, Eileen, too, is less than pleased by this turn of events. Bob Fosse choreographed the musical numbers for this charming comedy written by Blake Edwards.
link.title: synopsis
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
Dr. Seuss's The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T

link.synopsis: American Hank Dussard (Dean Jones) inherits a ramshackle olive plantation in France and is determined to restore the property. Problem is, he needs laborers with small fingers and a gentle touch to harvest the olives. Dussard's novel idea? Import a quartet of trained chimps with dexterous digits to do the work. Talk about monkey business. Maurice Chevalier (in his last role) and Yvette Mimieux co-star in this Disney family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Flight of Noah's Ark
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit
The Strongest Man in the World

link.synopsis: Directed by Gene Kelly, this all-star romp centers on faithful married man Paul Manning (Walter Matthau), who's tempted by his philandering friend Edward (Robert Morse) to cheat on his beautiful wife (Inger Stevens) -- even though he doesn't really want to. Adding to the comedy, an arsenal of celebrities appear in illustrative how-to vignettes, including Lucille Ball, Sid Caesar, Art Carney, Jayne Mansfield and Carl Reiner.
link.title: synopsis
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
Jayne Mansfield Collection: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?

title.regular: A Guide for the Married Man
title.short: A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: A Mexican immigrant (John Leguizamo) trying to make ends meet in Los Angeles enters a singing contest and achieves the American Dream -- and then some. Before long, he finds himself stuck in a romantic triangle with Mirabella (Elizabeth Peña), his forty-something neighbor, and Nina (Ana Claudia Talancón), a twenty-something veterinary student. This light romantic comedy marks the directorial debut of Renee Chabria, who also penned the screenplay.
link.title: synopsis
How the Garcia Girls Spent Their Summer
Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
I Could Never Be Your Woman

link.synopsis: Politics meets showbiz and 21st-century pop culture in director Paul Weitz's mordant comedy. For the first time in four years, President Staton (Dennis Quaid) picks up a newspaper and soon becomes a virtual hermit as he begins questioning his narrow worldview. Unnerved by the president's behavior -- and to get him back in the limelight -- his chief of staff (Willem Dafoe) books him as a guest judge on the hit talent show "American Dreamz."
link.title: synopsis
Being Mick: You Would If You Could
Looking for Comedy in the Muslim World
A Colbert Christmas: The Greatest Gift of All
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
The Brady Bunch in the White House
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra

link.synopsis: Sibling rivalry runneth over when a West Coast gangsta rapper starts directing his brother's ho-hum choir in this uplifting comedy about the redemptive power of gospel music. Fleeing his irate producer, hip-hop star Teshawn (Billoah Greene) seeks refuge at his twin's (Darien Sills-Evans) Baptist church in Harlem. Te's unorthodox approach may be just what the congregation's choir needs, but he'll have to go through his estranged sibling first.
link.title: synopsis
Donnie McClurkin Story: From Darkness to Light
Three Ways to Get a Husband
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
I Can Do Bad All By Myself
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play

link.synopsis: Acclaimed St. Louis comic Kathleen Madigan unleashes her sarcastic, perfectly timed delivery on such subjects as George W. Bush, tattoos, math, sports, aliens and more in this hilarious stand-up performance. Voted Best Female Stand-up at the American Comedy Awards, Madigan -- a former journalist and Mid-Missouri Hoop Shoot champion -- shows no mercy in this scathing set recorded during a live show in Denver.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Craig Shoemaker: Live: That's a True Story!
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Suzanne Westenhoefer: Live at the Village
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
Ralphie May: Girth of a Nation
Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Penn & Teller: Off the Deep End
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Harry Shearer: Now You See It
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet

link.synopsis: Sticking to his practice of helming bikini-centric films, director Fred Olen Ray (using the pseudonym Nicholas Medina) rolls out a campy horror comedy featuring a ghost that will leave you speechless. When buxom actress Muffin Baker attends the reading of her uncle's will, she inherits the wealth of his assets, inciting the family lawyer and his daughter to plot against her. Luckily, help is on the way in the form of a scantily clad female ghost.
link.title: synopsis
Bikini Girls from the Lost Planet
Bikini Chain Gang / Bikini Airways: Double Feature
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
Bare Wench 3: The Path of the Wicked
Rod Steele 0014: You Only Live Until You Die
Timegate: Tales of the Saddle Tramps
Masters of Horror: Dario Argento: Jenifer
Masters of Horror: Dario Argento: Pelts
Masters of Horror: Rob Schmidt: Right to Die
The Skeleton Key 2: 667 Neighbor of the Beast
Masters of Horror: Valerie on the Stairs
Masters of Horror: We All Scream for Ice Cream
Masters of Horror: Mick Garris: Chocolate

link.synopsis: Legendary actor, comedian and Golden Globe winner Bob Newhart hogs the spotlight in this rare stand-up comedy performance, lighting up the stage with his trademark deadpan wit, finding the funny in everyday topics. In this program, recorded in 1995, Newhart tosses out hilarious thoughts about King Kong, cheap airlines, crazy inventions and rambunctious bus drivers -- and that's only the beginning.
link.title: synopsis
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Rodney Dangerfield: No Respect: The Ultimate Collection
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Jackie Mason: The World According to Me!
Make 'Em Laugh: The Funny Business of America
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Tess: Looking for My Next Ex-Husband
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Live from the Laugh Factory: Vol. 1
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Rod Z: I Ain't Lied Yet!
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Having squandered his sizable inheritance, self-centered New York playboy Henry Graham (Walter Matthau) schemes to marry a wealthy woman -- and then kill her. But when his new bride, Henrietta (Elaine May), proves to be an innocent klutz, Henry starts to change. Soon Henry is disposing of his self-serving ways instead of his wife. Co-written and directed by May, this romantic comedy was nominated for two Golden Globes, including Best Picture.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
A Guide for the Married Man
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
Monty Python and the Holy Grail

link.synopsis: Doris Day and Richard Widmark play Isolde and Augie Poole, childless suburbanites who after years of trying to conceive, decide to adopt a child in this Gene Kelly-helmed comedy. A pretty adoption agent (Gia Scala), a hapless husband and a drunken night out on the town, however, throw a monkey wrench into the couple's family planning process. Gig Young and Elisabeth Fraser play the Pooles' annoyingly fertile next-door neighbors.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: I'll See You in My Dreams
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
A Guide for the Married Man
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

link.synopsis: Planning to elope with a bandleader (Jack Carson) she's known only four days, oil heiress Joan Winfield (Bette Davis) hires pilot Steve Collins (James Cagney) to fly them to Nevada. But Joan's father makes Steve a better offer to bring her home unmarried. All bets are off, however, when they're forced to make an emergency landing in the desert in this screwball comedy also starring George Tobias and William Frawley.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Came to Dinner
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: After leaving a man at the altar, Pamela Matthews (LaRita Shelby) falls in love with a charming pastor (John Maddox), but her plans for marriage are dashed when he reveals that he doesn't want her to pursue her dream of becoming a jazz singer. Her friend Jackson Jones (Perry Cornelius), however, advises Pamela to follow her heart. Gail Gibbons plays Pamela's irascible grandmother in this entertaining romantic comedy from director Jill Maxcy.
link.title: synopsis
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Soul Theater Series: The Fabric of a Man
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
I Think I Love My Wife
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right

link.synopsis: Friends Jacquie and Nicole share the same birthday and have always celebrated it together. But for their 16th birthday, the girls decide to have separate parties and soon become bitter rivals as they compete to see who can throw the best bash ever. Real-life sisters and teen pop sensation Aly & AJ star in this lighthearted teen comedy based on the MTV reality television series "My Super Sweet 16."
link.title: synopsis
Bring It On: In It to Win It
Bring It On: Fight to the Finish
Bring It On: All or Nothing
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen

link.synopsis: When a blond bumpkin (Jessica Simpson) discovers that her boyfriend's been cheating on her in Manhattan, she strikes out on her own as a big-city career girl. Little does she know that a pair of corporate villains (Penelope Ann Miller and Andy Dick) is using her as a pawn in their evil scheme for success. Luke Wilson, Willie Nelson and Rachael Leigh Cook also star in this Working Girl-style romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Confessions of a Sociopathic Social Climber
Comanche Moon: Road to Lonesome Dove
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold

link.synopsis: Teenage best pals Judy (Jane Powell) and Carol (Elizabeth Taylor) find their friendship put to the test when they both fall for the same suave fellow (Robert Stack) in this breezy musical comedy. Meanwhile, Judy's on a sleuthing mission to find out if her father (Wallace Beery) is having an affair with a gorgeous rumba dancer (Carmen Miranda). Legendary bandleader Xavier Cougat and his ensemble make an appearance at the high school dance.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind

link.synopsis: Hoping to buy a house, grocery store assistant manager Doug (Seann William Scott) applies for a manager position at his chain's new location. Doug feels confident about getting hired until recent arrival Richard (John C. Reilly) applies for the same job. In order to secure the coveted promotion, the competing employees go head-to-head in minor battles, often resorting to cruel behavior in this indie comedy directed by Steve Conrad.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard

link.synopsis: When newly single Hanna (Silvia Navarro) receives a big divorce settlement, she and her friend Amanda (Shakti Urrutía) deposit the entire amount in the bank -- but unfortunately, the money inadvertently goes into someone else's account. Now, Hanna faces a series of misadventures as she meets a variety of men while trying to retrieve her money and attempting to secure a new job in this entertaining romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
El Lado Oscuro del Corazon II

link.synopsis: As human guinea pigs for experimental medications, treatments and products, best buds and roomies Peter (Steve Markle) and Ron (Jeff Kassel) must frequently battle bizarre side effects -- such as pregnancy, memory loss and paralysis -- that make their lives miserable. In Season 1 of this comedy series, the guys test out several powerful gadgets, such as a military-grade vacuum cleaner and electric chastity belts.
link.title: synopsis
My Own Worst Enemy: The Complete Series
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Best of So Graham Norton
Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs
Kröd Mändoon and the Flaming Sword of Fire
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
Robot Chicken Star Wars: Episode II
The Best of Comedy Central Presents
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
The Best of the Colbert Report

link.synopsis: Obsessed with his chic Madrid restaurant becoming rated in the prestigious Michelin guide, openly gay chef Maxi (Javier Cmara) runs into endless personal problems when his estranged children suddenly reenter his life and a hunky ex-footballer (Benjamn Vicua) moves in next door. Full of delightful twists and turns, this Spanish romantic comedy co-stars Lola Dueas, Chus Lampreave and Luis Varela.
link.title: synopsis
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo
The Other Side of the Bed
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man

link.synopsis: After discovering that his lawn has been completely destroyed by raccoons, frustrated Jeff (Tobey Maguire) foolishly cheats on his wife, Nealy (Elizabeth Banks), which leads to a series of agonizing predicaments involving his best friend's husband (Ray Liotta) and next-door neighbor (Laura Linney). Written and directed by Jacob Aaron Estes, this dark comedy also stars Kerry Washington, Sam Trammell and Dennis Haysbert.
link.title: synopsis
What a Man Wants, What a Woman Needs
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Get ready for your favorite vaudeville and comedy act, The Three Stooges -- aka Larry, Moe and Curly -- to tear things up in color capers and "Stooge Toons," including "No News is Good News" and "Squawk Valley." Other hysterical episodes include "Kangaroo Catchers," "No Smoking Allowed," "The Bigger They Are, the Harder They Hit," "Get That Snack Shack Off the Track," "The Noisy Silent Movie" and 14 more.
link.title: synopsis
Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 1
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Three Stooges: Nutty but Nice
The Three Stooges: Goofs on the Loose
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
The Three Stooges: Cops and Robbers
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 3
Snow White and the Three Stooges
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
Laurel & Hardy: Air Raid Wardens / Nothing But Trouble
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 4
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
One Night in the Tropics / Buck Privates / In the Navy / Hold That Ghost

title.regular: The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 2

link.synopsis: In this endearing TV comedy series, aliens call upon mild-mannered schoolteacher Ralph (William Katt) to save the world, bequeathing him a fabulous red superhero outfit with extraordinary powers -- which, unfortunately, Ralph has no clue how to harness. Now, with the help of girlfriend Pam (Connie Sellecca) and FBI agent Bill (Robert Culp), Ralph must learn how to fly without crashing and otherwise control the suit even as he faces down a variety of foes.
link.title: synopsis
The Secrets of Isis: Complete Series
The Incredible Hulk: The TV Series Ultimate Collection
Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman
Doctor Who: Resurrection of the Daleks
Doctor Who: Warriors of the Deep
Doctor Who: The Brain of Morbius
Urusei Yatsura Ova 1: Inaba the Dreammaker
Doctor Who: The Horns of Nimon
Doctor Who: The City of Death
Doctor Who: The Mark of the Rani
Doctor Who: Revelation of the Daleks
Doctor Who: The Invasion of Time
Doctor Who: Image of the Fendahl

link.synopsis: Fred McMurray's portrayal of the wise, earnest widower Steve Douglas raising his three sons with the help of his father-in-law, "Bub" O'Casey (William Frawley), was the key to this elemental 1960s suburban domestic comedy. Sibling rivalries, neighborhood intrigue and assorted challenges of childhood and adolescence generate engaging and often hilarious life lessons, as do Steve's often awkward relations with members of the opposite sex.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of the Adventures of Ozzie & Harriet

link.synopsis: Proudly provocative funnyman Aries Spears ("Mad TV") pulls no punches in this outrageous standup comedy show, in which he takes hilarious aim at what ails modern America, from rampant racism and hypocrisy to overblown political correctness. Filmed live before a sold-out New York City audience, Spears takes special care to skewer a topic not so close to his heart: the cold business of corporate Hollywood.
link.title: synopsis
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 3: Launching Pad
Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Mike Epps Presents: Live from Club Nokia
Kevin Hart: Laugh at My Pain
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Chocolate Sundaes Presents: Live on Sunset Strip!

title.regular: Aries Spears: Hollywood, Look I'm Smiling
title.short: Aries Spears: Hollywood, Look I'm Smiling

link.synopsis: This romantic comedy follows London-based physician Manu as he reluctantly returns home to India at his parents' behest to find a bride. To his delight, he meets the girl of his dreams, Tanu-only to discover that she is enthralled with another man.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai

link.synopsis: Too-smart-for-his-own-good 10-year-old Henry James Herman sets out to locate his father, an anonymous sperm donor, in this quirky comedy. Along the way, Henry uncovers family secrets that only deepen his existential quandary.
link.title: synopsis
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden

link.synopsis: Investment banker Daniel Morris has a wonderful life, a successful career and a beautiful fiance. But when he can't resist the lure of a gay one-night stand, he finds it hard to return to "normal" in this witty romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: British comedian Steve Coogan returns to the role of Alan Partridge in this online comedy series that finds the fictional presenter back on the radio. Every good disc jockey needs a sidekick ... but finding one could be easier said than done.
link.title: synopsis
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
The Best of Ground Force: Garden Rescues
Changing Rooms: Trust Me, I'm a Designer
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Cards on the Table
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: After the Funeral
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Taken at the Flood
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Mystery of the Blue Train

The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special

The Best of So Graham Norton
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Doctor Who: The Seeds of Doom

link.synopsis: A high-voltage combination of sketch comedy, songs and animation, this 1970s Emmy Award-winning children's series teaches kids basic reading and grammar skills and stars three outta-sight teachers: Morgan Freeman, Bill Cosby and Rita Moreno. This collection of episodes includes the best skits, hits and 'toons from the show, featuring favorite characters such as Spiderman, Road Runner, Letterman, Easy Reader, Spell Binder and J. Arthur Crank.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of The Electric Company: Disc 1
The Best of The Electric Company: Disc 2
The Best of The Electric Company: Disc 3
The Best of The Electric Company: Disc 4
The Best of The Electric Company: Vol. 2

Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids
Sesame Street: 40 Years of Sunny Days
Carole & Paula in the Magic Garden
Sid the Science Kid: The Ruler of Thumb
Bear in the Big Blue House: Shapes, Sounds & Colors with Bear

The Bugs Bunny Road Runner Movie
The Looney, Looney, Looney Bugs Bunny Movie
The Hardy Boys Nancy Drew Mysteries
Sesame Street: 20 Years ... and Still Counting

title.regular: The Best of The Electric Company
title.short: The Best of The Electric Company

link.synopsis: Shortly after being appointed the U.S. ambassador's second in command in a war-torn Eastern European country, Sam Keenan (Jean-Claude Van Damme) is faced with a coup d'etat and the nation's president is forced to take refuge at the embassy. A group of armed insurgents attempts to storm the building, and it's up to Keenan and a small squadron of Marines to fend off the attackers and protect their precious cargo.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Four gorgeous gals -- Norma (Ursula Andress), Luisa (Virna Lisi), Paola (Marisa Mell) and Esmerelda (Claudine Auger) -- decide to hit the town one night in a big way, leaving behind their husbands (Brett Halsey, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Frank Wolff, Marco Guglielmi). The women, unhappily wed for their own reasons, decide to treat Rome like a playground and to find romance in other men's arms. Luigi Zampa (A Yank in Rome) directs this Italian comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Directed by Jon Alpert, this Home Box Office documentary follows -- literally -- charming Chris Colombo, an everyman under house arrest and facing federal indictment on racketeering charges. Cameras capture Colombo as he spends time at a strip joint, goes to confession and enjoys dinner with friends at his favorite Chinese eatery. After missing his curfew thanks to a traffic snarl, he concludes his busy day playing poker at home with pals.
link.title: synopsis
Secrets of the Dead: Gangland Graveyard
Lucky Luciano: Chairman of the Mob
Investigating History: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
Unsolved History: Forensics in the White House
NBC News Presents: Buried Secrets: Cold Case Uncovered
The Journalist and the Jihadi: The Murder of Daniel Pearl
National Geographic: World's Most Dangerous Gang
The History Channel: Busting the Mob
The History Channel: Oklahoma City Bombing
Unsolved History: JFK: Death in Dealey Plaza
The Murder of Emmett Till: American Experience
Fashion Victim: The Killing of Gianni Versace
Secrets of the Dead: Executed in Error
Autopsy: Postmortem with Dr. Michael Baden
Frontline: The Dancing Boys of Afghanistan
History's Mysteries: The Hunt for Jack the Ripper
Scottsboro: An American Tragedy: American Experience

title.regular: House Arrest: A Docu-Comedy Based on Reality

link.synopsis: William Boot is a nature writer who is mistakenly posted to Africa to cover a civil war. As he deals with a gallery of eccentric characters, Boot improbably stumbles onto a major journalistic coup in this comedy based on an Evelyn Waugh novel.
link.title: synopsis
P.D. James: Death of an Expert Witness
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

link.synopsis: Fresh from the Space Academy, pilot Chris Blair (Freddie Prinze Jr.) has a genetic gift for sensing time-space continuum problems. And he'll need all the edge he can get when he squares off against the hideous Kilrathi Empire in interstellar battle. Matthew Lillard and Saffron Burrows co-star as Blair's fellow Terran Confederation fighter pilots, who help him kick some alien butt in this sci-fi extravaganza.
link.title: synopsis
Heavy Gear: Battle for the Badlands
War of the Worlds 2: The Next Wave
Roughnecks: The Starship Troopers Chronicles: Trackers
Star Wars: Episode III: Revenge of the Sith
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country

link.synopsis: Writer and director James Toback (Black and White) explores a contemporary love triangle in this comedy-drama. When two girls (Heather Graham and Natasha Gregson Wagner) find themselves waiting outside an apartment building, they come to realize they're there to meet the same guy (Robert Downey Jr.) -- who's been sleeping with them both! Armed with this knowledge, the girls break into the guy's apartment and prepare for the ambush.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints

link.synopsis: The love lives of 14 people intersect at the Plaza del Sol in Madrid one day in August. Vignettes include stories of mistaken identity and comedies of error involving people who are both gay and straight -- and everything in between. A young movie director mistakenly gets a ride from a prostitute; a struggling actress goes to desperate measures to impress the wrong director; a woman hires an escort who may be a relative.
link.title: synopsis
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Set in the Midwest in 1927, this comedy-drama centers on the challenges faced by the manager of a tent show. Walter Hale (Elvis Presley) manages the Chautauqua, a traveling show that entertains and educates audiences. Hale is constantly badgered by union organizer Charlene (Marlyn Mason) to adhere to strict union laws, and when a pharmacist (Dabney Coleman) is murdered, it's up to Hale to find the killer. Vincent Price has a cameo appearance.
link.title: synopsis
Live a Little, Love a Little
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
A Guide for the Married Man
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis
The Return of the Pink Panther

link.synopsis: When corrupt real estate mogul Arnold Gruber (Robert Fieldsteel) evicts Joe (Michael Phenicie) and Lisa (Andee Gray) from their dwellings to make way for new buildings, martial arts-trained Joe turns sexy Lisa into his ninja disciple, and the two team up to fight back in this erotic action comedy. Gruber sends his own ninjas to eliminate Joe and Lisa, who may have trouble focusing on the enemy as they're consumed by their lust for each other.
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: John Landis: Deer Woman

link.synopsis: Tragedy and comedy blend in a love story told via flashbacks, chronicling the doomed affair between the moneyed young Marcus (Michael Brandon) and the sultry but irresponsible Jennifer (Tippy Walker), who first meet in Venice, Italy. After following her back to New York City, Marcus becomes as hooked on Jennifer as she is on heroin -- and the inevitability of a sad ending to their romance looms ever closer. Watch for Robert De Niro in a bit part.
link.title: synopsis
Masterpiece Classic: A Room With a View
The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman

link.synopsis: The war on drugs in America is escalating uncontrollably, so the government takes matters into its own hands with an extreme plan called Code: Black, which will wipe out the black market drug trade for good. But does that justify murdering drug dealers and poisoning the country's illegal drug supply? Can anyone stop this madness? Sylvester Person, Elizabeth Thomas and Rob Brian star in William Lee's crime drama.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Oleg Yankovsky and Rolan Bykov play two soldiers -- a former photographer and his best pal -- in this moving drama, a classic directed by Yevgeni Karelov and set in war-ravaged 1920s Russia. As the White Guard slowly falls to the pressures of the Red Army, the shutterbug is sent to photograph enemy strongholds from the air. But he does more than that as he and his pal take on the arduous task of documenting the Red Army's final days of glory.
link.title: synopsis
Eugene Onegin: Classic Motion Picture with the Bolshoi Opera
Sleeping Beauty: Classic Motion Picture with the Kirov Ballet
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears
Three Films by Alexander Sokurov: Oriental Elegy / Dolce / A Humble Life

link.synopsis: Love of cinema is the common passion that unites several contrasting cultures in director Uli Gaulke's 2007 Sundance Film Festival entry. From an Indian movie buff's screenings of Bollywood hits to West African film fans' creation of an open-air theater in their village, great movies fuel the subjects' lives. Follow six movie aficionados for whom bringing great flicks to their respective audiences is an unconditional pleasure.
link.title: synopsis
A Bookshelf on Top of the Sky
The Short Life of Jose Antonio Gutierrez
The Monastery: Mr. Vig and the Nun
Hitler's Museum: The Secret History of Art Theft During World War II
The Prisoner or: How I Planned to Kill Tony Blair
A Musical Journey: Prague: A Musical Tour of the City's Past and Present
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss
What About Style?: Alex Katz: A Painter's Painter
The Life and Art of Ernst Ludwig Kirchner

link.synopsis: The incomparable Bing Crosby stars in this charming double feature. In Just for You, he plays Broadway producer Jordan Blake, a workaholic who's grown estranged from his children (Natalie Wood and Bob Arthur). Determined to get to know them, he takes the kids on a vacation with his girlfriend (Jane Wyman). In Here Comes the Groom, directed by Frank Capra, Crosby reteams with Wyman as a foreign correspondent who comes to the aid of two orphans.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: Just for You / Here Comes the Groom
title.short: Just for You / Here Comes the Groom

link.synopsis: Crime may pay, but it doesn't necessarily pay well -- at least not for small-time hood Eddie Coyle (Robert Mitchum), who's about to be hauled off to jail for gunrunning, leaving behind a wife and kids but not a penny to his name. Desperate to salvage his freedom, Coyle begins serving two masters -- the cops (as a snitch) and his criminal associates (as a weapons supplier) in this 1970s gem helmed by Peter Yates.
link.title: synopsis
The Killing of a Chinese Bookie

link.synopsis: Released in 1992, this contemporary adaptation of Shakespeare's comedy stars Emma Croft as young noblewoman Rosalind; Andrew Tiernan as her suitor, Orlando; and Celia Bannerman as her cousin, Celia. Performed in modern dress, the classic drama of ardent romance and false identities preserves much of the hilarity and elegant language of the original play. The cast also features veteran actors Cyril Cusack and James Fox.
link.title: synopsis
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: Brent Towers, the Christian Cowboy, rides the range and teaches Christian values in this collection of animated shorts for kids, kicking off with "Danger on the Pioneer Express," in which Brent and his pals foil a plot to destroy the railroad. In the other three tales, the Christian Cowboy brings the bad guys to justice, teaches his young friends about God's wisdom and spreads the Gospel wherever he goes.

link.synopsis: When ex-cat burglar Bernice Rhodenbarr (Whoopi Goldberg) inadvertently witnesses a murder, she enlists help from her friends, wacko poodle-groomer Carl (Bob Goldthwait) and drunken floozie Frankie (Elizabeth Ruscio), to help solve the crime and prove Bernice's innocence. Next thing you know, Bernice and her pals find themselves trying to outwit tough guys galore and two stupid cops (Anne DeSalvo and John Goodman) in this amiable caper comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
Whoopi: Back on Broadway: The 20th Anniversary
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: Tim O'Hara (Jeff Daniels) takes in an alien with plans to exploit him, but has second thoughts after the alien wins his trust in this comedy based on the 1960s sitcom. Hunted by scientists, the Martian (Christopher Lloyd) poses as O'Hara's uncle and works on a plan to return home. A love story on the side has O'Hara choosing between vixen co-worker Brace (Elizabeth Hurley) and the deserving Lizzie (Darryl Hannah).

My Favorite Martian: Time Travelers Favorites

Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Back to the Future Part III
Back to the Future Part II
Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

link.synopsis: Prime-time sitcom star Jerry Seinfeld gets back to his roots in stand-up comedy with this performance at the Broadhurst Theater in New York City, which was one stop on his sold-out international tour. And just as in the comic's hit TV show, everybody's a target -- from octogenarian motorists and cab drivers to doctors, dry cleaners and innocents buying milk at the grocery store. Not that there's anything wrong with that.

title.regular: Jerry Seinfeld: I'm Telling You for the Last Time

link.synopsis: Teen bad girls Crystal (Natasha Lyonne) and Cyclona (Maria Celedonio) escape from jail and head for Tijuana, where they hope to find Sister Gomez (Vincent Gallo), the nun who helped out the psychotic Cyclona when she was a child. But violence has a way of springing up all around these two, and no one is safe in their path. David Alan Grier, Nicole Parker and Max Perlich co-star in this over-the-top crime comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Romantic Rio de Janeiro is the backdrop for this sensuous comedy. Widowed English teacher Mary Ann (Amy Irving) is resigned to living alone. But to her surprise, she finds two men vying for her affections: middle-aged lawyer Pedro Paulo (Antônio Fagundes) and young soccer superstar Acacio (Alexandre Borges). But the love triangle gets more complicated when Acacio falls for Pedro Paulo's sexy law clerk (Giovanna Antonelli).
